thread.title: De Blasio swings and misses on famous Yogi Berra quote
thread.title_full: De Blasio swings and misses on famous Yogi Berra quote - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: De Blasio swings and misses on famous Yogi Berra quote
text:
Susan Watts/New York Daily News Mayor de Blasio said in an interview about New York City possibly being spared of Hurricane Joaquin, ‘As Yogi would’ve said, ‘It ain’t over until the fat lady sings.’’ The only problem is that isn’t how the famous Yogi-ism goes. Mayor de Blasio, a Red Sox fan who grew up in the Boston area, whiffed when he tried to use famous a Quote: from Yankee great Yogi Berra Quote: in a radio interview on Friday.
De Blasio, in an interview with WNYC’s Brian Lehrer, was asked if New Yorkers could relax now that the weather forecast predicts Hurricane Joaquin was not going to hit the city.
“As Yogi would've said, ‘It ain't over until the fat lady sings,’” de Blasio said.
That’s not what Berra would have said.
The correct Yogi-ism is, “It ain’t over ‘til its over.”
YOGI BERRA'S MOST FAMOUS Quote: S: THE WIT AND WISDOM OF THE LATE YANKEES LEGEND
KATHY WILLENS/AP Yogi made famous the line ‘It ain’t over ’til it’s over.’ De Blasio apologized for misquoting the Yankees legend. Told he misQuote: d the icon, who died last month, de Blasio apologized.
“I’m sorry I’ve misQuote: d Yogi and I apologize,” he said.
“But I will now take the opportunity to say my favorite Yogi Quote: , which is, ‘90% of this game is half mental.’”
It’s harder to say if he got that one right.
Over the years, there have been different versions of that Berra Quote: .
Sometimes it is remembered as "Baseball is 90% mental and the other half is physical.”
But others times it’s Quote: d the way the mayor used it.
